subject: AI
title: Graceful Degradation
description: What happens when the AI service goes down.

hook.text: Your AI search is down. Users see a blank page. No search results, no error message, nothing. They think the whole app is broken.

buildup.text: Graceful degradation: when the AI service fails, fall back to a simpler experience. AI search â†’ keyword search. AI summary â†’ show the raw document. AI chatbot â†’ link to FAQ.

discovery.text: Design the non-AI fallback first. If your product doesn't work at all without AI, you have a single point of failure. The AI should enhance the experience, not be the experience.

twist.text: Cost spikes count as outages too. If your AI costs suddenly 10x (API rate change, model update), you need the ability to gracefully switch to a cheaper model or turn off AI features.

climax.text: Every AI feature should have a fallback. Test the fallback regularly. Users should notice degradation, not complete breakage.

punchline.text: Your app should still work when the AI doesn't. Design the fallback before you design the feature.

quiz.question: What is a good practice for AI product resilience?
options: Make AI the only way to use the product
Design non-AI fallbacks so the product still works when the AI service fails
